John's Grill is an institution in the City but as is well known, institutions can start to simply trade on their status letting the quality of the food and service slack.  John's Grill has NOT done either.  I have never had a bad meal here.  The steaks are always presented as ordered and are delicious.  The seafood is perfectly prepared. The waitstaff is attentive to all details and do all they can to make your visit a pleasant one.  It is also fun to watch who comes in on any given night.  This is a place where local politicians and well know celebrities have been known to appear and I have seen this a few times on visits here.

The cost of dining here in not inexpensive but it is not outrageous either.  On my last outing which was 4 days prior to this review we spent with tip, 200.00 for 4 people.  That is half  of what we would have paid at say Ruth's Cris or Harris for the same meal.  I have seen some reviews ere where people complained of the quality of their steak.  I personally have never had that problem.  I order a rare steak and that has been what was put in front of me every time.  It has always been perfectly aged, seasoned and prepared.  I did once have an issue with an item ordered and called it to the waiter's attention.  He quickly apologized, whisked it away and returned with what I had expected.  No attitude or any sort of unprofessional behavior.

The people watching can be amusing here as well.  Local and state politicians are regular patrons as are more well known celebrities.  One my last visit Willie Brown cam walking by headed for a little sit down with a few other gentlemen.  He was his usual gracious self - exchanging greetings with people who recognized him.

This is a place I have always enjoyed eating at.  It is not a place I go to every week as my budget would not allow that but whenever I am downtown for an occasion like the theater, opera or symphony, as well as, when with friends wishing to make an evening of it, this is a regular dinner selection.
author: John P.

description:
When I first moved to SF, I came here because of the hype.
Honestly, it does not measure up.
The steak was just ok. Nothing special...
The salmon was also just ok. I feel like I could make better at home.
The prices are ridiculous but what do you expect from a downtown resto..
author: Leslie M.

description:
Definitely pricey, but worth it to go treat yourself- especially if you have company from out of town and want to show them a classic San Francisco institution.

What can we say about John's? It's the home of the Maltese Falcon!! Be sure to order Sam Spade's lamb chops, they are incredible!!
author: Paul H.

description: We were walking past and came in because of the sign out side. The food was good and our server Bret was very helpful and nice. However, I didn't particularly want to hear workplace gossip between the 2 hostess girls. The swearing and bickering was completely unnecessary and made what would have been a great experience, into a mediocre experience. I am very happy with Bret's service though, so if you get a chance to come here, perhaps ask to sit away from the hostess stand.
author: Keri S.

description: Fun place. Just stopped in for a drink. Nice bartender and friendly group. I loved the vintage feel of the place.
author: Shari T.

description: Not sure why this place is 3 1/2 stars, should at least be a four. (Maybe the steak? Have not tried though.) The service and food presentation are fancy. Definitely made it feel more formal than a casual place but we dined wearing jeans and sweaters. At first glance you'd think there was not enough food but after digging in it was clear it was more than enough for one person. Price was perfect for two. Two full meals, two sides and one appetizer to share was about $50. Only downside was that I felt the menu was limited.
author: Rosey L.

description: Wonderful place. Service was prompt and attentive food was spot on and the atmosphere was old school. Old head shots on the walls and wood grain everywhere. I felt like at any moment somone could get whacked. I would really recommend this place for a relaxing meal. Drinks were stiff but not over done and the waiter was on top of everything. Give them a try next time your in the city.
author: James E.

description: Absolutely fantastic! The wait staff was superb - the bartender was witty & it was a great experience - HIGHLY recommend the Oysters Wellington & the T-bone - regardless this is a must!!
author: Cari S.

description:
Very nice interior design. I didn't make a reservation in advance so I can't complain too much about the seating, but be warned that if coming in a party of 2, you may be seated in a cramped small table stuck to the wall. 
We ordered the lobster ravioli, filet mignon, and the red snapper. I was slightly disappointed by the lobster ravioli, the filet mignon solid as expected, but the red snapper was the star of the meal. 
I'd say I paid for what I got in terms of quality, but I don't think I'd come back here again because there wasn't anything special/outstanding.
author: Kevin L.

description: The service was great. The food was served fast and a there was a decent portion. The food was tasty. I would definitely  return. Also important to note is that the prices were reasonable for an expensive city like SF. The only item that could be improved is the iced tea...tasted like it was from a mix and not fresh brewed.
author: Linda B.

description: The food was great. Service good. Everything was splendid until my cappuccino after dinner. A baby roach crawled out of the sugar bowl and across the table. Waiter was very apologetic but no visit from manager or discount offered. Dessert was offered but we were no longer hungry. Very disappointing.
author: Karen G.

description: I ate a fisherman pasta. It was very bad one. The pasta was too much. It feels like ramen not a pasta. And the sauce was not creamy as well. And the balance of taste was really bad.
author: Uijin Y.

description:
One of the best steak house located in downtown San Francisco. 
Check it out for there flavorful steak. I had filet mignon dish beside that mash potato just as amazing together with streak.
Highly recommend.
author: Nuntiya K.

description: Excellent steak at a reasonable price. The history of the establishment adds class.
author: Matt O.

description: The best atmosphere! Awesome food. Deep martini glasses. Love coming here for authentic wood paneled steaks and seafood old school restaurant. Always packed, and with good reason. Locals and tourists will find it a delight
author: Ryan S.

description: Don't go here. It was recommended by the the hotel I was staying at and its a tourist trap. The service was so rushed. My partner took his last bite of a $40 steak and within seconds they were clearing his plate. The food came out 10 minutes after ordering and my seafood pasta dish looked so unappetizing it literally took my appetite away. I sent it back. I hadn't even finished my cocktail and they were trying to take payment. The whole experience was really bad.
author: Mary Beth S.

description: love!  old san francisco. classic!!!!  my fave for a hungry meal.  great value!
author: Anne A.

description: This place is a tourist trap.  They rush you through your meal so they can turn the table.  We had apps and dinner, and we're done in less than 30 minutes!  The prawn cocktail had one old and quite smelly prawn, but the others were fine.  I told our server and he said, "sorry about that!"  I thought for sure he would bring another or remove it from the bill, but he didn't do anything.  The steak was almost all fat and very cheap quality.  It looks like the place to be is downstairs.  They put us upstairs in tourist central.  I will not be back.
author: Dad with Kids x.

description: My husband and I like to try different places to eat after a Giants game.  This place was recommended by the Visitor's Center.  The atmosphere is cloth tablecloths with a sheet of paper over the cloth so they can reuse them I guess, cloth napkins, lots of pictures on the wall of law enforcement and ex mayors.  The food is w-a-y over priced for the quality.  My shrimp cocktail was gross with the shrimp tasting like it was soaking in water.  It was limp.  I only ate 3 of the 5 for $14.99!  The chowder was tasteless.  The bread was good!  My husband had Chicken Jerusalem which was good but $27.00?  Not that good. After dinner I went to the bathroom and that is where I got grossed out.  Eew! Sticky door handles, corners of floors caked with ??? matter, dirty mirror, smell of old mop.  I can only imagine what the kitchen looked like.  Two stars because the staff was kind and attentive.  The food for the price Nadda!
author: Lillian V.

description:
I had  Oyster Wellington.  Creamed spinach, smoked bacon, baked in puff pastry
on a bed of sherry cream.  That what it said on their menu. It was 3 pasty dough balls mixed with creamed spinach a size of a meat ball without any bed of sherry cream.  There were tiny oyster squished inside the balls.  Also, we seated upstairs dining area but the down stair area was much cooler old fashion feeling than upstair seats.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Disappointing. Stepped inside, it was nice and fancy, but when the food came in, it was TERRIBLE it was BELOW BASIC. The most dry and bad tasting sandwich I've ever eaten so far. After sitting inside and eating the food I ordered, I can say that its such a wanna-be-5-star restaurant. The food is already pricy, why not make it taste good?

And their ravioli tasted like it just came out of a Chef Boyardee can LOL. My iced tea, so gross... Even McDonalds can serve better drinks 

I liked the fries though but that was it. I guess the ketchup was good too? Heinz though
author: Justine G.

description: Nothing special about this place. John's is a traditional steakhouse with traditional steakhouse pricing. I ordered the ribeye. The steak was mediocre at best, and the sides were quite bland. I would not recommend dining at this restaurant.
author: Kyle B.

description:
I and my friends are exchange students from several countries, and we were walking along the street in San Francisco to find something to eat and we found this restaurant. It looks great both the outside and inside so we decided to eat there. 

We got in, sat for a while, and we ordered. I ordered Fried Sea Scallops and a lemonade. We waited for about 45 minutes for the food (a party of 7) to arrive. My scallops are awesome, no complaint about that, but during the meal THERE IS NO SERVICE, NEITHER FOR REFILLING THE LEMONADE NOR ASKING HOW WE ARE DOING (as I recall, it supposed to be a FULL-SERVICE RESTAURANT). I do not know why don't we get ANY service, maybe because we are students and you think we don't have the capability to pay for the food, i don't know??!! (If the manager is reading this review, please answer this question)

After the meal, we asked the waiter to separate the bill and he said he couldn't separate it individually but he could separate it into the party of 2 (we were fine about that). When the bill came, EACH bill contained about $5.8 for the SERVICE CHARGE...WTF?! (REMINDER: NO SERVICE DURING THE MEAL) So we disappointedly paid for the food and walked out of there.

This is my recommendation for those who would like  go to this restaurant: wear NICE tie and suit so you can get a FULL-SERVICE.
author: Chaiwat S.

description:
Wow! What a disappointment! First time to John's Grill and the last. The clam chowder was overpriced and had no clams. The drinks were okay as was the desert. The steaks and chops were just okay. 
The place was so noisy you couldn't hear folks talking. Sam Slade would not have been happy 
.
author: Kevin O.

description: Ambiance is smoking, just arrived from Foo Fighters and Killers concert at the pier. Was hungry. Grabbed a tuna salad, a slight disappointment, just hold the tuna next time. BUT, the decor, nostalgia and a phenom jazz band that outdid the two bands above! Made my day and closed out my eve perfectly. Stick to the steaks and other seafood. Real jazz...
author: Steve S.

description: Terrible service. Waiter spilled a drink on me and did not bother to comp is for it. My dish was awful and entire meal was way overpriced. Do not waste your money here there are much better places to eat in SF
author: Julie E.

description: Super old-school charm and food to match. Had the calves liver and onions and it was delicious.
author: Tim W.

description:
Was looking for an American food restaurant for lunch before seeing Wicked at the Orpheum, and I found John's. Thanks Yelp!  

We enjoyed lunch salads first, mine with a mustardy creamy vinaigrette (which I loved) and Mom had the blue cheese. Both were great!

I had the Fisherman's Pasta. It was loaded with many types of seafood in a very rich cream sauce. I absolutely loved this as well! So yummy! Very hearty portion for $17.95.  Mom had the Fried oysters which came with vegetables. She said the breading was light but the oysters were quite small. I doubt she would order again, and I think it was about $15.95. 

All in all it was a great experience. I would go back tomorrow if I could.
author: Lisa C.

description:
The filet mignon was excellent. I love their baked potatoes too, flaky and flavorful. We come here a lot and I usually get fish so enjoyed the change. The Christmas decorations were festive. 

The bartender caught his error on our martinis and brought new ones before we even had time to flag down the waitress.
author: Cynthia G.

description: Surprised this place only had 3 stars on Yelp, but we wanted seafood, and a place near our hotel. It's easy walking distance from the Convention Center area. I had the grilled Pacific Red Snapper, with a lemon sauce, and it was one of the better pieces of fish I have ever had. Cooked perfect, and the lemon sauce was just right. My business associate had the seafood cannelloni and also raved about it. This place is very good.
author: Mike B.

description: The food was wonderful. John and I enjoyed our meals. I would give five stars but the wait was very loud with dishes. On a plus note, she was very friendly and was always somewhere to be found for refills.
author: Beverly Q.

description: Just celebrated our 41st Anniversary there! Everything we had was excellent!Mussels, Roquefort Salads, and Jerusalem Chicken. The Creme Brûlée was excellent! Our only issue was being on the Second floor and it was a little warm!
author: Burt M.

description:
If you're a fan of the Maltese Falcon, or even if not, this is a classic SF restaurant and one of my favorites. It's tucked away in the heart of SF making it a bit of a challenge to find and the old neon signs sends a misleading message that its a dive. The inside is historic SF and the walls covered with pictures of famous people who have frequented the place, not to mention Dashel Hammett. The service is always good, except on my recent visit, the server was just "ok". No need to wait for a special occasion to dine here. 

Among my favorites is the New England clam chowder, seafood cannelloni, fishermen's pasta, chef's special red snapper, and the chicken Jerusalem (I got my mom hooked on this one). The steaks aren't bad either and a throwback to the old days where you got the sides and not just a piece of meat. 

If you visit, check out the vintage bar and try to get a table on the second floor as it seems less crowded and a little more classic. During my last visit, we sat on the main floor and it was uncomfortable as I was squished up against the table because the lady behind me was on the plus size and my sister across from me was squished as well due to the plus size guy who was seated there after us.
author: Gordon H.

description: Where do I start?  First of all, the inside smells like roach spray.  My girlfriend ordered the the lamb chops and I had the fisherman's pasta...both were AWFUL. She ordered the lamb chops MEDIUM, and they came to the table RARE as steak tartare and were tough as rubber.  The seafood in my pasta tasted/smelled fishy, and was overcooked.  Both of our meals were in desperate need of salt.  If I could give this place 0 stars, I would.  DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE!
author: Whisper C.

description: So here's the deal: we are vacationing in SF. We want a great dinner at an iconic SF landmark. And we are staying around the corner from John's Grill. We read lots of Yelp reviews before we headed over, with, I admit, some trepidation. We went anyway. SO glad we did! Ignore the sour and mediocre reviews! Sit upstairs and listen to the great guitarist in the corner duking it out with the lively conversation and clanging silverware. Order the mussels: FABULOUS mussels! Order more bread. Sop up every drop of broth! Stab the busboy with a fork if he tries to clear the bowl from the table! The mussels were huge, tender, perfectly cooked, and swimming in a garlicky pool of utter deliciousness. Once we had licked the bowl, we split a medium rare ribeye, our appetites fueled by a couple of kick-ass old fashioneds. Excellent flavor, perfectly done, accompanied by tastily  seasoned fresh vegetables and a fat baked potato that we slathered with butter and sour cream. A completely satisfying steakhouse dinner. Go. You'll have a blast, enjoy your meal, and weave home doing Peter Lorre and Humphrey Bogart impressions. Don't forget to take a selfie with the Maltese Falcon.
author: Susie M.

description:
seating is way too crowded. the food wasnt well prepared - we had mussel appetizers (the beards were still there and not scrubbed). we had prawn dijoneuse - gritty and overcooked. the waiter, while not rude, certainly could have come by once to ask how our dinner was.  

we're not going back
author: Anthony F.

description: I went here for my boyfriends birthday and it was really yummy. We got the escargot for an appetizer, the fillet, and a rib eye. It was all amazing! If I had a bigger bank account, I'd go every day. The food was pricey but worth it.
author: Tomi A.

description: Went here after a couple of months of avoiding it as I am more interested in feeding the soul Han he belly for my dinners while in SF on business travel. An I should have kept away. Not that it is bad, but the live music I better across the street. The food here is much better, but I only was eating a salad. I would come again once off a diet, but until then it is off my list of spots to eat at.
author: Christopher S.

description:
Me and my wife Travel to the city at least once a month and stay there at one of the many hotels during the summer. We always find our selves eating at Johns
 grill. The soup is to die for. Sometimes I wonder if the "great soup Nazi" from Seinfeld is working in the back. Because my knees buckle at the taste of the soup. Service is great. I even took both my daughters there to eat and they love it and they go there them selves now.
author: Sam A.

description:
The tinkling strains of piano music drifts in the fog. A streetlight glows in the dark and illuminates the front door of a small, nondescript restaurant. A man looms out of the night sporting a long trench coat. A wide brimmed hat obscures his face. The mysterious figure slips through the door. 

When I follow him in, I find Phillip Marlowe, who looks remarkably like Humphrey Bogart, smirking and sneering by the bar while smoking a cigarette. Dashiell Hammett is tucked in a corner scribbling in his notebook. The piano player turns out to be Nat King Cole who starts singing a wistful tune in his smooth, mellow voice.

In reality, it was in the middle of a hot, sunny day in December. I was doing some holiday shopping around Union Square and I decided to break for a late lunch. I wanted to get away from the crowds, but didn't want to walk too far from the stores, so I decided to eat at John's Grill. 

Food was OK. Very solid and dependable. I decided to be daring and got the escargots in garlic cream. The appetizer came in a dish that had little wells that reminded me of an artist's painting palette. A snail nestled in each well. The snails were chewy and once I got over the "ewww" factor, quite tasty. I got the NY steak sandwich. Very basic but well executed. 

Service was efficient if harried. I think I must have come during a shift change. For the first half of my meal, it seemed like my server was covering the front door, the bar and the tiny dining room all by herself. Luckily, I wasn't in any hurry and was prepared to linger and rest my weary feet. 

The restaurant itself had a lot of character. Dark wood floors. Celebrity photos lining the dark panel walls. Potted palms and green leafy plants lined a half wall divider. Brass lamps brightened the space. The bentwood chairs felt very fragile, mine creaked every time I shifted in my seat.

The first floor dining area is small since about a third of the square footage is taken up by the kitchen and bar. The restrooms are on the second floor, past the kitchen and up a cramped stairwell. The upstairs dining room is bigger and actually kind of cool. A replica of the Maltese Falcon from the film perched in a display case at the head of the stairs. While not on my short list of "go to" restaurants, John's Grill is the place to go if you want to step back in time or into a movie.
author: Cece E.

description: Just visited San Francisco for the weekend took my 4 year old on her first plane ride. After touring the town decided to have a nice steak dinner. Johns was recommended and was it a great choice. Was so happy when they took us to the 3 rd floor yes 3 floors of jam packed people. The third floor was a lot cooler and I was happy about that. Sat down ordered a few drinks and the shrimp cocktail. Right off the bat I was happy to be sitting here. The shrimp were delicious and the apple martinis hit the spot. Our waiter Erik made our dining experience great my 4 year old was so smitten with him. I had the filet cooked perfect for me along with a baked potato and asparagus on the side. Everything was delicious including the dessert. Will be coming back for sure next time in SF. Thanks again Erik for the great dining experience.
author: Michelle Z.

description: Awesome! Great service, fresh food, and reasonable prices. Hubby and I both got steak lunches, SO good!
author: Christine S.

description:
The restaurant is over 100yrs old.  Their steaks are from Harris Ranch and aged.  The food was good and cooked properly though I needed to add more salt and pepper to my steak.  

Their shrimp cocktail was mediocre at best (one of my shrimp was missing it's tail??) and the ambiance is chatty with an average age being approximately 45 or so.  

The only problem I had was with our server.  He was not interested in serving (asian, islander guy).  I understand that anyone can have an off day and we all have personal stuff to deal with but leave that sh*t at the door and do your job properly.  Servers on that level should have to wear name tags and remember, there are steakhouses on every other block in this city and they are all highly rated. That's all I have to say about that.
author: Sam L.

description:
So the reviews were neither great nor particularly horrible - so I took the risk and headed here for dinner.

While Open Table showed no reservations until 930p- I figured as a party of 1; they could get me in pretty quick; which they did a great of.

The place was as described: an old feel - but clean and friendly. For a minute I thought I might be near Hells Kitchen in New York at a cramped lifted restaurant there.

The server was quick and very knowledgable.  While I didn't take her up on her 1st recommendation,  she did pick out a great steak choice and I was on my way.

The good was neither amazing note disappointing. I suppose had my expectations been very high- I wouldn't have been happy; but it was good. 

The steak was cooked properly; but the baked potato was nothing more than that and the veggies were something that reminded me of college.

But taking in he whole vibe, the friendly and attentive staff; it was pretty decent.

If you want 5 Star - don't come.
If you want cheap eats - stay home.
If you want a good meal with friendly folks, give it a try
author: Jim D.

description: I brought 8 co-workers here for convention meal and they were all very happy with service, food and atmosphere. My steak was done as requested and my meal was delicious in whole. We ate on second floor and it was fun, noisy, drinks were flowing, service was humming and the dinner was great.
author: Chuck D.

description: Great food good service good wine!!! I got the ribeye .... If u like your steak medium rare order rare other then that everything was awesome! Cesar salad was to die also!!!
author: Shelly M.

description: We got in late but they promised a table if we waited 30-40 min. Unfortunately we got a table  on the third floor, they didn't tell us that they where not going to seat us on the ground floor. I would have liked to sit there. The third floor was a very old decor. The tables, chairs, walls and flooring did really not feel like a restaurant. The atmosphere was not really a place you want to have your dinner in a city visiting as a tourist. The best thing was the food, the meat was perfect! The pasta very creamy and nice. The waiters was very quick. I would have given 5 stars but the venue was really not nice.
author: Hülya T.

description:
John's Grill is the historic San Francisco staple. I have enjoyed romantic dinners, productive business meetings, and some very much needed alone time at this establishment. 

I had the pleasure of having an incredible dinner last night. The food was delicious, the crowd lively, and the service out of this world. 

Don't miss out on: Jack Lalanne's Salad, Chilean Sea Bass, Bone in New York paired with the Twenty Bench Cab!

Can't wait to be back!
author: Crf C.

description:
I just had dinner here and I ordered the ribeye steak. Now, before I delve in to this review. I am a ribeye steak eater and I have eaten in one of the best and worst steakhouses. The ribeye steak here is very flavorful and cooked to perfection. The only comment I have us that the meat is not "PRIME". In addition, the steak has been pounded to its second death by a meat tenderizer. It's a great way to make a cut of meat tender but not if you are charging $29.95 for it. The verdict...awesome steak but over priced. The acceptable price for the steak should be around $17.95 plus or minus $2.00

The service was top notch.
The restaurant was small and cramped.
author: EJay D.

description:
We went there a couple of times, and always enjoyed the experience. The scenery in there is just beautiful and historical, and also very comfortable. The food went from quite good to really great depending on our choice (without ever being crazing amazing).

The service is usually really great, except that one time when the guy was very distant, but was doing the job well anyway.

We'll go there for sure when people visit, this is definitely one the best restaurants downtown!
author: Rudy R.

description:
One of the best steaks I've ever had! We've seen it on many occasions but never stopped on until now. 
Friday night,  only 20 minute wait. Its a smaller place, but very lively. The staff were all very nice.  The christmas decorations and music were perfect!  Very nice birthday dinner.
author: Heidi S.

description: Although the food and service was good, the host really was offensive.
author: Gordon C.

description: I went there before going to a play at the SF Playhouse. The ambience is wonderful-it feels as if the bar and restaurant have been around since 1908, the decor and banquettes have a feel to them of an earlier period. The service was pleasant, attentive, and efficient. I had the filet mignon and it was extremely tender and perfectly cooked. My grandfather owned a meat company so I'm pretty picky about my steaks but this one was excellent. My son had the salmon and it was perfectly cooked and had a great sauce with it. He also had the clam chowder which he loved. The seasonal vegetables were nothing special but the sourdough bread basket was a nice addition. We also split an order of chocolate mousse. The mousse was light, fluffy, and rich but not too rich. All in all, a lovely evening. I would definitely return if I was in the area.
author: Marceline W.

description:
Was passing this place hundreds of times and always wanted to have lunch or even better have dinner and listen to jazz there.
Well;))) I dream came true ! The place is very popular and was crowded , but there was a place for two upstairs , so we could have a nice seafood dinner with wine and enjoy live music. My next visit there will be at lunch time. I am sure I will enjoy it too. It's a great place with perfect food, music and history!!!
author: Tatiana R.

description: Place sucks. Seafood fisherman pasta was frozen seafood at best. Service was terrible and the place was no where near packed. Unless you're a huge fan of mystery novels, I'd pass this place in a heart beat.
author: Phillip T.

description: This was our second time here and I have to say I was a little disappointed with the oyster Wellington this time. Service was good and the ambience too.
author: Rico A.

description:
I hadn't been to John's Grill since eating with a lunch group there a few times in the early to mid 1990's when the food was OK, but not memorable.

A friend hosted a birthday dinner for me yesterday at John's and it was very good, indeed!

I had the salmon which was a generous portion nicely prepared. Also had a Caesar Salad which was excellent and better Caesar than served in most places.
Service was attentive and friendly.

Our group was in the top floor room which was very comfortable and not too noisy. The entire dining experience was excellent.
No surprise that John's Grill has been around 105 years because it's truly an SF gem.
author: IQuack D.

description: Love love  thus place  old school  steakhouse  and great  spot took my  6 month old and they were  great about it  good wine  selection and great great steak and seafood
author: Sarah H.

description: Service was good but did feel rushed to get in and out with the family. Overall I thought the steaks were just ok. Price was right, however, for the quality of the beef served.
author: Jason P.

description:
I forget how my friend and I ended up here, but I believe it had something to do with either our original lunch destination being closed, or, more likely, us being too lazy and/or hungry to trek out to it. Being a block away, and having been here before with a client, my friend opted to eat here instead - immediate gratification won out over tastier food, unfortunately.

It's a bit tough for me to classify the decor of this place: a mixture of neat and kitschy, it's definitely geared towards an older crowd, and tourists too, at that, given its location. That said, not wanting to drop $30+ on a diverted lunch, I ended up ordering the deluxe burger for $13, while my lunch companion got their ravioli. Both dishes were decent, with the burger being a very simple one - but, for $13, I'm expecting an amazing burger (a la Thermidor).

Friendly service and okay food leaves these folks with 2.5 stars.
author: Johnny W.

description:
The saving grace for this place was the service and atmosphere. Our waiter was very attentive and the hostess was sweet. Beautiful place. 

When I go to a $$$ steakhouse I expect to have a great steak. I ordered the ribeye. What I got was a  less than 1/2 thick steak that was not well seasoned and slightly over cooked. Sad! The Claim Chowder was canned soup quality, the side vegetables that came as a side were just steamed boring and bland. The baked potato should not have been the high point of the meal.

The wife teased me about how much I wanted to go to this place after walking past it all week. I really wanted to  have a great memory about a great meal with my wife in San Francisco here. Disappointing.
author: Todd B.

description: WOW! Amazing place right in the center of Union Square.  Love the old world vibe.  It's like what all of the new places are trying to be.  Great cocktails, classic with hip brands like Remy 1738 (go Fetty Wap).  Had the seabass, my husband had a great steak.  Definitly going back!
author: Lisa R.

description: We had a wonderful evening at John's Grill celebrating a friend's birthday. I was so impressed that they were able to add two people to our reservation last minute. The service was on point and the food was delicious, highly recommend the calm chowder!
author: Angie C.

description: The death of Mrs.Macall prompted my short review tonight. The restaurante being famous for a movie plot. The service is great in this old fashioned Old school menu and atmosphere.The California grown salad is crisp and fresh and the chowder was heavy,rich,the bomb just the way you want it.I Had a grilled halibut seared to yumfection! I'd go back....after my good blood screening as a reward! :-)
author: Brian D.

description: Must say that the ribeye steak was ok but not for the price I had way better ribeye steak for less friendly staff but it's dark inside and I don't like eating in the dark unless I'm camping
author: Dennis H.

description: This is an old school steakhouse, so that's what makes it classy, but it's casual too. I had the Jack LaLanne's Favorite Salad and loved it!
author: Shari B.

description: Our waitress was pathetic. Steaks were nicely cooked, but relatively low grade for the price. Bread is very good, a nice and sour variety.
author: Norman F.

description: My aunt and I were staying at the hotel next to this restaurant and the concierge highly recommend this place to us. So we made a reservation and had high hopes. When we got there the place was packed which usually is a good sign. After we had time to look over our menus my Aunt told the waiter that she was stumped as to what she should get. Instead of offering some assistance he just left us alone. Every time he came to check on us it seemed as though he was rushing us to hurry up and get out. Not very good customer service. I ordered lobster ravioli. It was an appetizer that was a tad over priced. When I tried my food I noticed that the lobster was EXTREMELY minced and grainy. To the point were you couldn't even tell that there was lobster inside of it. My aunt ordered the oyster Wellington, specialty dish featured in gourmet magazine, which had nothing special about it. My aunt found her food extremely bland. Don't get us wrong, the food was not awful but it was definitely not worth the price. So, as  we are trying to leave the waiter notices that almost to all of my aunts food is still on her plate. Instead of asking if everything was okay or if she wanted to box anything up, he just takes the plate and leaves. So... long story short...... this place was a waste of money.
author: Avory G.

description: A beautiful Friday afternoon in the City by the Bay was made even better with a great Lunch at John's Grill.  The classic decor sends you back to the roaring 20's. The clam chowder was one of the best we have had in years. The homemade 1000 Island dressing served with the fresh Bay Shrimp salad was exceptional. Overall a 5 star lunch.
author: Allan A.

description: Amazing clams, Manhattan, and steak! Also no wait on a  Saturday.... Def worth the visit.
author: Josh G.

description: Amazing jack la lane salad and petrale sole. Awesome ambience for dinner with that real old school SF feel. I would eat here any chance that I could!
author: Devin E.

description: Had amazing dining experience. The food was delicious...I ordered the Lamplighter and my husband enjoyed the T-Bone steak and creamed spinach. My girls enjoyed the Clam Chowder and Ravioli. When in San Francisco, I will definitely visit again.
author: Shon-Tai B.

description:
Whether visiting San Francisco or a local San Franciscan--it is a must see, must visit and must dine...
Service, food and ambiance represent old San Francisco and a nice respite from the hustle and bustle of downtown.....
author: Eric Q.

description: The Filet Mignon, and the Clam Chowder are my recommendations. The Filet Mignon almost melts in your mouth. Probably the best clam chowder I've had in San Fransisco. I just wish the seating was more spacious. But overall, great food and a great atmosphere! Do recommend when in SF
author: Tyler U.

description: Come here for a nice JUICY steak. Everything tastes super fresh and was not overly seasoned. Good food makes my tummy happy
author: Riley P.

description:
John's Grill is not really wheelchair-accessible, but I love them enough to put up with it. Any place that's been around since 1908 gets a bit of a pass. The bathrooms and upper floor are not accessible, and the ground floor is packed and narrow. Let them know that your party includes a wheelchair and they'll do their darndest to make things work; they'll need to pry open the front doors and maybe move some chairs. (Wheelie tip: there are lots of hotels nearby whose bathrooms are only a block or two away.)

This place is serious old school, so if that isn't what you like, don't bother. Leave room for the rest of us. 

In case you somehow don't know already, John's Grill is mentioned by name in the text of 'The Maltese Falcon' as a place where Our Hero gets a chop. A collection of mystery writers and buffs helped keep the place going, and the upstairs function room used to feature an original copy of the Falcon itself from the movie (it was stolen a while ago, not sure if they ever got it back). The walls are covered in photos of famous writers and City luminaries and historical newspapers and the like. It's old and classic. 

John's also gets by by shilling itself out on the list of Fine Recommended Dining at a lot of local swanky hotels and convention lists, so expect it to be packed when the Association of Surgeons or whoever are in town. It's less packed on weeknights and great for lunch. You want to get a reservation. On the rare occasion where I've had any problems with the service, it's because the place was packed to the gills with conventioneers and they were swamped. 

The menu is old and classic and features that aforementioned Chop as well as some tasty local specials and great steaks. My partner is fond of the Jerusalem Chicken. I get a steak usually but the seafood options are also tasty. The wine list is decent and they know their way around a classic bar menu very well; Cocktail Snob has never had a complaint here. 

Take a noir buff or old-school dining connoisseur here for a treat. Not ideal for big groups unless you're reserving the upstairs inaccessible room, but for meeting your girlfriend's parents or treating a visiting boss type, John's Grill has your back.
author: Anne K.

description:
My co-workers and I came here for a team dinner. Such an old school steak house!  There was a bit of a line, and the 1st floor was a bit warm inside. Which means, where we were sitting on the 2nd floor, would be worse...

The ribeye steak I had, was as expected juicy, flavorful and tender. Not too much fat was left, just enough to do the job, and not feel like you had a poor fat to meat ratio.  The included potato was a disappointment, it was overdone.

The part that brings them down two stars... Service. Not that they weren't prompt, which they were.  It's the barging in over the shoulders shoving in food, refilling water etc that was annoying.  No "excuse me coming," so we could lean over and away. I kept getting bumped each and every time they brought something to the table. I kept getting splashed each time they poured water. Annoying.

No acknowledgement to me saying thank you. In fact, I'd argue the hostess refilling water didn't want to be there at all, that night!  

Was the steak good? Yes. The service was just not personal, not inviting, and not friendly.
author: Mitch N.

description:
Went there for dinner with my wife and her CEO. 

It was appropriate for the occasion. Loud enough to feel as if conversation is not a problem, but not so loud that you cant have one. Ben Stiller was there, which was an interesting bonus.

Staff and service was prompt and courteous. I opted for the New York strip, which was well cooked and a good size, but a little chewy. The sides were a let down - baked potato with some snow peas and a single slice of courgette.

As you are paying similar prices, it does not compare well on food alone with The Palm or Ruths Chris, but the overall experience was comparable.
author: John G.

description:
This was the best food I had in San Francisco during my 3 day stay!

Best Clam Chowder I've EVER had in live.. says a lot because I'm in Baltimore, MD and we're known for our seafood of course!

I ordered the "favorite" salad... Awesome and huge and 2 Raspberry Lemonades (spiked with Bacardi Limon).

Wish I would have went back instead of eating the horrible hotel food at the Standford Renaissance twice :(
author: Erica B.

description: Food is  very good. I had the clam chowder and I was very pleased with it. Great texture and taste. Menu is slightly overpriced as is the drink menu. The door of the place a little old fashioned. But the pictures of celebrity and public figures had a nice touch to it.
author: Andoni R.

description: it is a famous restaurant. the location is very convenient, near union square. the bar is located at the first floor, so looks little crowded and louder, but not inside. the steak was ok. the servers were very attentive. they might not have an air conditioner? it was very warm inside.
author: Jessica P.

description: My husband had the T-bone. Very fatty and un editable! The meat tasted sour like it was marinated in a bad cheap red wine ! I had the seafood cannoli it was OK, very salty. The cannoli was supposed to have spinach and mushrooms but mine was pure Bay shrimp and and tiny bits of crab. No mushrooms and just a few pieces of spinach. I took a bite of my husbands T-bone and it was chewy, stringy and pungent! He told our waitress (who it wasn't her fault) that "This is the worst steak I've had". The fact that this is supposed to be an "institution 1908" was very disappointing! I do not recommend nor will I every go there again. I must give kudos to our waitress, the quality of food is not her responsibility, yet she made every effort to make us "happy" by taking the steak off our check and giving us a free dessert which we did not expect or ask for. We left her a tip as if we were charged for everything. This place is best for a cocktail after a long shopping day!
author: Sara C.

description: Service was great, nice music & food topped off a nice evening out with hubby.  Tables are close together, but you can still move in & out.  Would come back.
author: Laura W.

description:
The Boyfriend & I were scheduled to see a show & we made the mistake of not securing a dinner reservation. After peeking into a few places that were full, we found a table here.

Since we didn't hace a lot for imd left until curtain, we dove right into ordering entrees. I got the Chicken Jerusalem which - according to the menu - was quite well recognized. The sauce was tasty but without it, the chicken & the rest of the dish was very bland. Furthermore, the meat of the chicken was quite mushy.

When we were finished we had a little time left so we ordered the Chocolate mousse torte. I liked that it was not very sweet; however, I was also missing the silky richness that chocolate mousse should have.

The service was mediocre but efficient & we were content as we left through the doors  & through the crowd of people waiting outside.
author: Karen S.

description: Service is amazing, food is ok but expected a bit more glam for what we were spending at least food wise. The ambience is nice, nice jazz, not to loud not to quite able to have a noce conversation without yelling, however, the meal itself was underwhelming, presentation was mediocre and the amount and flavor also mediocre.
author: Courtney W.

description: This is a tourist restaurant:  overpriced and not the best in this area.
author: J H.

description:
I know this place is a San Francisco icon, and have dined here years ago.  I took my parents here during their visit but later regretted the choice.

The ambiance of the restaurant has this classic look with its wall filled with photos of celebs and politicians who dined here over the years.  Once seated, the menus came out - yikes prices were all on the high side -- no problem if we are paying for quality.

The best dish was the special seafood salad, which could easily serve four people.  Entrees went downhill after that.  The seafood pasta was too rich and the fish chunks were bland.  Ditto for the red snapper entree my parents shared.  I ordered the lamb chops which weren't bad - nice spicy exterior crust and meat not overlooked too badly. However I've had much better at Persian restaurants at half the price.

This restaurant may be an icon, and maybe our dinner selections were poor.  Maybe this place is better at steaks than fish.  Unfortunately, I'm not going to find out since SF simply has too many other good options.
author: Daniel C.

description: I was very let down by this place. Service overall was good.  I ordered the 39.95 Porterhouse steak. I ordered it med-rare, it came out medium. I waited for a bit for the server to come by.  Got tied of waiting and was running out of time, so I started eating it. It was very dry and bland in flavor. I have paided way less for a porterhouse at other places and gotten a lot better flavor and steak overall. Such a shame,  with all the hype about this place. Frankly my steak tasted like it came from Sizzler. Such a shame.
author: randy t.

description: This is a solid steak house. Will return on future trips. Food, service and overall atmosphere was great. Had the NY and it was very good.
author: Ken H.

description: Convenient location. Not impressed with food. Dishes didn't taste fresh, some of the ingredients seemed originally frozen. Service needs improvement as well.
author: Irina G.

description:
This place was mediocre. But cool idea. We loved that it was a historic restaurant and somewhat old school. The waitress was already pretty nice. The food was just okay. And for the price of our meal it should have been way better! They sat us upstairs tucked between a boring old couple and a foreign couple. Not a big deal usually, but we were sat so close to each other there was no such thing as a personal conversation or private dining! Very much a bummer when you are on a romantic getaway with your husband! 
I wish we had gone somewhere else. So we most likely will not eat here again.
author: Jennifer M.

description: This is actually the first review I've written. I'm neither picky nor a total foodie but I chose John's Grill because it was directly behind my hotel. I knew I wanted fish and so I chose the snapper. At the urging of the waiter (and for $6 more) I chose the chefs special with snapper and a crab cream sauce. It was simply remarkable. I was alone so I took my time. I left one Bute on my plate for at least ten minutes. The waiter asked to take my plate and my reply was "no, I just don't want this meal to end." I can't vouch for anything else but the chefs special snapper was the best thing I've ever put in my mouth and I'll be chasing that taste from here on out.
author: Jason S.

description: Old-school steak house, excellent service, 2 courses, 2 appetizers, 1 bottle of wine and 2 glasses of champagne for $160 including tip can't be beat along with the location and history. Dine upstairs for a more intimate experience.
author: Lou S.

description:
Delicious steaks, nothing fancy just really good steaks. Expectations are met, not really exceeded but there's nothing wrong with that. 

Cuts are selected well, prepared well and service was great. 

If you're in the area it's an absolute must visit. The decor is pretty cool as well
author: Eric N.

description: I always hated stake. My man decided to help me order and I got the stake. OMG... it was great.  Must visit this place when ever you are in San Francisco.
author: Tahanae B.

description: I had a great experience here. Great service. We had an awesome waiter. Suggested really good food for dinner. We had escargot, oysters for appetizers. The waiter suggested the red snapper. It was amazing!!! Definitely coming back here!
author: Elaine D.

description:
3 stars because it wasn't bad, but it wasn't anything stellar. I don't know about the history so I can't really appreciate the maltese falcon. I can only comment on the atmosphere, service, and food. 

We got a reservation on OpenTable and came in at 8pm on a Saturday. 

Atmosphere: It is cramped. War-zone like on a Saturday night with diners dodging servers in the narrow lanes between tables. It is dim, and rather annoying that many other customers were flashing their bright iphone lights everywhere when reading menus. The live music was very good, but since it's so small and packed with people, the roar of conversation overrides it. We were really only able to hear it because we were sitting directly next to the keyboard. 

Service: Server was really nice, but it took him so long to get anything. Refills on water, waiting for him to come around and bring more bread, waiting for him to come so we could place our orders, waiting for him to come to ask him to get the check, etc... If I had to guess, it wasn't his fault but rather that they were understaffed. 

Food: My lamb chops were very tender and quite flavorful. I also go the escargots which were nothing to write home about, but my friends were impressed having never tried snails before. Our table also shared a couple bowls of clam chowder which was the highlight of the evening. The other entrees at the table were not very good. The Seafood Cannelloni was full of cream and cheese more than anything and my girl friend's ribeye was very tough @ medium rare. We're total steak connoisseurs and have a hard time believing that it was grade A dry-aged beef. 
Bottomline: Soup, appetizer, and lamb chops were alright. The beef and seafood weren't worth it. 

Go somewhere else for that rare night out. You can get much better food, service, and ambience better for the price.
author: Farrah N.

description:
My most recent book club meeting was noir/crime fiction.  Our two selections were "Maltese Falcon" by Dashiel Hammett and "Postman Always Rings Twice" by James M. Cain.  In keeping with the theme we decided to meet in SF, and John's Grill was a great selection since it was featured in the book.

I think the fact that this restaurant was featured in the Maltese Falcon is the only thing it has going for it.  It's an expensive restaurant with a limited menu.  It's expensive and the portions aren't huge.  The good is kind of old fashioned cuisine typical of the early 20th century.  The decor is dark, heavy and oppressive.  I didn't feel comfortable or invited.

i ordered the hang town fry and it was decent.  I thought it was a little bland and not the most interesting meal but it was ok.  My other book club friends seemed to enjoy their food but no one raved.

This is a great tourist spot and was perfect for our book club.  However, there are so many more interesting restaurants to eat at in SF that I don't feel a need to return here.
author: Ryan L.

description:
I can't imagine why anyone would go here, other than the supposed "history"... Seems it me that it's skating on past reputation? Was there on Wed evening with some business associates, steaks were really mediocre, thin and fairly tough- very indifferent service, noisy, had appetizer plate of feta cheese and olives, two slabs of dry feta cheese mounded with a whole pile of olives, no oil, a few carrot slivers piled on top-Meh!

Prices are on par with high end steakhouses, but the food and service sure aren't-there are MANY better choices in the Union Sq area for steaks-I suggest you avail yourself of them
author: David B.

description:
after a 7 hour hour drive to San Francisco, my fam bam and I were starved. We were to early to check in to our hotel so we parked and looked for a spot to eat. It was our first time in San Francisco and we were pretty confused with the streets. There seemed to be Burger Kings everywhere. With rumbling tummys, no desire to eat Burger King, and the need to get out of the car we went into the first restaurant we could find which happened to be johns grill. The place is cramped, they didn't seem to have a table for a party larger then 4. My daughters chair was added to the side of our 4 top table in the walkway. (We had a party of 5) When we looked inside we saw a couple with a 3 or 4 year old so I assumed they had kids menus. Boy was I wrong. Our waitress came over and we asked if they had grilled chicken or chicken strips...nope. She said she would give us time and never came back. We decided since we were there we would bite the bullet and allow our kids to order the $27 steak....each. After about 20 minutes of our waitress ignoring us every time she passed by (I think she wanted us to just leave) another waiter dropped some bread at our table as he was passing by to deliver food. I'm pretty sure he felt bad for us. Finally after another 5 minutes another guy came over and took our order. He was nice and made up a lot for our waitress that abandoned us. My kids enjoyed their steaks. My husband ordered the red snapper, it was delicious. I had the lobster ravioli. It was just ok. Had it not been for the gentleman that served us at the end....I wouldn't have given this place any stars (well one because yelp doesn't do 0 stars) 

Btw, another customer started yelling at our original waitress about the poor service she provided him. Obviously she needs to look into another line of work.
author: Yvonne S.

description:
Old school steak and seafood house. It's been here for better than 50 years. Old wood decor which I love for steakhouses. 
I had the bone in NY steak which was very good my wife had the filet also good both cooked right. They came with baked potato and broccoli which were not seasoned at all and did not complement the steak. Service was more than efficient.
author: J G.

description:
I have been coming to this place for lunch with my father for years. There are some drawbacks to this restaurant, but the pros definitely outweigh the cons. This review is for lunch time only.

First the price. Can't be beat. This restaurant is about 25% cheaper than you would find at pretty much any other place in the area for the same quality. The dinner prices negate this value as they are pretty standard nighttime prices.

Then the food. Foodies are definitely going to be disappointed. The menu, like all the great old-school restos left, hasn't changed in decades. And, yes this is a good thing. But old-school sometimes does not stand up to today's standards. For instance, the beef is cooked over direct open flame, so you get a lot more char on the steaks and burgers than you would normally expect. Cooked perfectly, just a lot of char. I'm not a big fan of this, but my dad loves it. My favorite dishes are the Jack LaLanne Salad, the clam chowder and the Crab Legs Supreme. Even though the Lamplighter (crab-stuffed sole) sounds better, the Supreme is a bit tastier. Now the clam chowder is hand down the BEST clam chowder ANYWHERE, no possible argument. It is simply perfect consistency and flavor. Their mustard vinaigrette is to die for, but the greens they put them on are a bit lacking. This used to be a straight green and/or red lettuce with tomato & cucumber slices, and they downgraded (in my opinion) to mixed greens, cherry tomatoes and cucumber pieces. The food is all top-quality recipes, even the mashers are whipped with butter and I think cheese. The french bread is excellent.
The décor is definitely showing its age. It's charming, but they need to upgrade the furniture and refinish the wood and other things. This is not a slight, it's just becoming a bit tired, but again, part of the charm.
Overall, if you get some favorites, you can't go wrong with this place.
author: Jeff S.

description: It's a MUST if visiting San Francisco! To die for steak :P nice atmosphere! Awesome service and friendly!
author: Wisarut W.

description: This place was awesome!! The service was quick, the meal was cooked perfect and the atmosphere cozy!
author: Shari B.

description: First of all, the food was definitely subpar-- I ordered the John's steak (which I assumed should have been good since they attached the restaurant name to it), and it ended up being so dry and tasteless that I had to ask for steak sauce to make it more edible.  I would've been fine with all of this as our group was just hungry and looking for a nice place to eat after our arrival to San Francisco, but the service ended up being terrible. Our waitress gave us difficulty with our check, and when I asked her a question to clarify something (which was just a repetition of exactly what she had said a minute prior), she sighed and rolled her eyes. What kind of service is this? One star for the service and the food certainly didn't help. I will not be recommending this place and will not be coming back.
author: Hannah L.

description: The absolute best! We held a private dinner 2 nights in a row and worked closely with Sean. They made everything seamless and perfect! Highly reccomend, and the food is simply amazing!  Can't wait to go back!
author: Claire C.

description:
My parents recommended this place to me while I was in San Francisco with my in-laws.  We made reservations which I would suggest, they even let us choose the area we sat in (upstairs, by the window).  

Environment- The restaurant is very old and very beautiful.  There was a jazz player who was amazingly talented sitting directly behind us.  He played the Beatles "Yesterday" upon my request (after I tipped him of course).  It was a busy Saturday night so the place was packed with people talking (or yelling...if you don't like noisy places I wouldn't suggest this one on a weekend).  I think it added to the ambiance.  

Food- I got the Chilean Sea Bass, others at the tables got the Halibut, the Prime rib, the Oysters, and some amazing seafood soup (by far the best pick!).  Everything was perfect! Each entree comes with a baked potato and vegies.  For dessert we ordered the cheesecake which was small but very good, the chocolate mouse which had a bit too much dark chocolate for me but if you like dark chocolate then I would suggest it, and a bowl of mixed berries and whipped cream...yum!

Price- A bit pricey, but my in-laws were paying so I didn't get to see the overall total
 
Drinks- I ordered the signature drink that comes with a souvenir glass..it tasted like a spiked shirley temple and it was very good!

Service- Our server wasn't the best I've ever had, he rushed us a little bit with the drinks and didn't come back to refill our waters unless we asked him and even then it took him forever...but he was very busy so we all understood.


Overall amazing environment, amazing food, we had a blast and will definitely come back! oh...I hope the same Jazz player is there!
author: Courtney M.

description:
Definately a tourist trap.  Came for dinner last Friday night to catch up with friends.  Also to have a bit of a laugh as we'd just come back from holidays in Malta.  It was packed with tourists.

Oysters were OK, nothing special but still tasty. Broiled halibut was bland, but sauce was delicious. Husband had a steak - he said it was satisfactory.

Service was amazing - a little too fast! It nearly felt like the meals were already prepared, and under a warming light it was that quick - and bordered on feeling like they were shuffling us out for the next diners.  However, the staff were REALLY courteous and as we took our time as we were catching up with friends we weren't asked to leave or anything... Don't feel the need to go back - but it was OK.
author: Beekay M.

description: Amazing restaurant. I don't really understand some of the negative reviews. I took my girlfriend here for her birthday. The food was delicious (Broiled Seabass, Ribeye, Cream of spinach) it was all cooked to perfection.
author: Pavitra J.

description: I really enjoyed the atmosphere and service was great. I was disappointed in the bread basket...it just wasn't that good of bread which is shocking since SF is known for its sourdough! My burger was good- nice quality meat, no frills. But why no cheese? Nothing too standout about it, but not bad.
author: Kiki H.

description: Blah! Disappointing! I made the mistake of booking Valentine's dinner here and was embarrassed. I was drawn to this place because of the live jazz. This consisted of a man on a keyboard tucked in a corner that we couldn't even see. I literally thought the music was piped until I got up to walk to the restroom and saw him! The food was SO bland. I ordered filet mignon and was so excited as I rarely treat myself to it and it was very dry and flavorless. The caesar salad was disgusting, such cheap ingredients. They need to understand that people take their partners there for a romantic experience. Put SOME effort into making the night special for them! When you walk onto the 2nd level and to the restroom you walk past where all the dishes are loudly thrown and stacked up. How tacky!
author: Jennifer K.

description:
I love classic steak houses as much as anyone, but those with a bit of history can sometimes take themselves a little too seriously. Such was the case with my first and only visit to John's Grill.

I was with a fairly sizable (about 8) and rather aristocratic group of friends; we were a bit demanding, so I'm willing to concede that may, MAY have been a factor in the poor service. But even so, there's just no real excuse for poor service.

Our waitress, a dippy young blonde, I think was more interested in ending her shift for the night than she was in actually providing great service. We had to ask multiple times for things like bread, butter, water. The topper was when I'd ordered a well done ribeye and was brought a medium NY, horribly pink in the center. I pointed out the error and was told, no, it was definitely a ribeye. Bullshit. 

Cocktails were overpriced and terribly weak. On the whole, the experience did not live up the hype, Maltese Falcon artifacts and all.
author: Anthony M.

description: Neither poor nor exceptional. Service was good though after we got our food and checked on us, they did not return to the table for a while despite needing a refill. The ravioli was acidic and the sauce didn't really compliment the seafood. It wasn't horrendous by any means, and the price was about what you would expect, but it wasn't the experience I had been hoping for.
author: Cody G.

description:
There isn't much else to say about a white table cloth restaurant which has been open since 1908.   But wow, the service and the ambiance exceeded our expectations.  

If you like PJ Clark's in NYC or similar "clubby" places, you'll like this too.
author: Mark P.

description: Live jazz guitarrist and an ok NY strip steak. Although I ordered it medium well, it should not have been as dry as mine came out. Also, the steak was really thin. Tasty, marinated in oil, salt and pepper...I was surprised that they have boiled asparagus on the menu but not grilled which I would have loved to have with my steak. Escargots - delicious, a must-have appetizer. Service upstairs was great, but the hostess downstairs was just...somewhere else. When I was trying to her attention when I walked through the door, she was on her cell phone, and she made a gesture to "wait a second". As she was putting the phone away, I noticed she was on Facebook. Didn't day hi, welcome, how are you or "good bye, have a nice evening" when we were leaving, she just isn't meant to be the hostess. A half of a star off for the steak and a star and a half off for the hosted. 3 stars.
author: Matija A.

description:
My family's gonna kill me because they love this place

I felt it was not up to the high standards of SF eating, yet definitely was commanding the same price tag.

The service was incredibly nice, yet sloppy.  They forgot drinks for some of us but not others, so we couldn't all drink together - and never came back to check, even when we asked for our waiter.  The food also came out at staggered times.

The food itself was very polarized.  The clam chowder is indeed very good, and any kind of meat you won't be disappointed.  However the bread, vegetables and potatoes were in another league entirely, and I don't mean a good league.  Quite literally diner quality.  Near-stale bread, potato plain and unremarkable, vegetables unvaried and overcooked.

I wouldn't be so harsh, but for the price I expect more.
author: Malachi B.

description:
Classic San Francisco and immaculate service! One of the best steaks in the city
I had the fillet mignon, medium rare, done to perfection. It was awesome!
author: Jay H.

description:
Very nice experience! Food and service was wonderful. 
Music was great too! I really enjoyed everything from start to finish. 
A true San Francisco dining experience with the decor and surroundings, Hostess was friendly and bartender was great! Did not have to wait long and will absolutely go back.
author: Dawn C.

description: Was recommended by a local paper as being very good so I called to make a reservation on a Saturday evening with all times available....should have been my first clue. I've waited longer for an in and out burger! Walked in at 7:15 ordered filet mignon and was finished with dinner at 7:45....tasted like something that u would get at sizzler. But great place if ur drunk and hungry and of coarse in a hurry
author: Bryan M.

description:
I enjoyed our food and dining experience last night, but it was good, not great. 

The filet mignon was slightly tougher than I would have liked. 

The service was extremely efficient, so much so it bordered on "brutally efficient." Admittedly, the friend I was with is a bit chatty, but the server could have shown a little more patience. And then he asked if he could take my plate when I clearly was only 70% finished with it. Finally, he dropped the check on our table without being asked. The place was busy, but it wasn't like there a line going out the door. 

OTOH, the opposite experience of constantly looking around for your waiter when you need anything drives me nuts, so I much prefer efficiency. But it wasn't a leisurely dining experience.
author: Bob S.

description:
The filet was fine. The drinks were fine. The service took 2 hours. The bill was 35% higher than what I'd pay for similar quality food. 

Not in a super talkative mood, obviously.
author: Alex L.

description: My mom and I happened to go in thinking it was sort of a mom and pop home cooked meal establishment.  I had oysters which were good and a 37 dollar steak which was tough.  The house wine was very good.  Mom had prawns and the same steak, again...tough.   It was even tougher when the bill was 150 for two with mediocre steaks.  Staff was friendly.   My opinion is there are better restaurants if your going to spend this kind of cash.
author: Rachael P.

description: Just got back from Johns Grille. Service and food was excellent. I had Cioppino and my wife had Liver and onions. We come here often and always leave happy.
author: Red A.

description: The best seafood ever!!!!!!! I m not really seafood fan cas I hate fishy things, but here has do delicious meals!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Lisa S.

description: Forgetting how crowded Union Square can be on a Saturday,  we didn't make reservations anywhere. With 5 of us, every restaurant was at least an hour wait.   We went to John's Grill and they could take us right away. It was great! I had the prawns and the Asian Pear Martini. My husband had the lamb, which he loved.  My kids had various steaks and they liked them as well. It's pricey but good. The ambiance is classic.
author: Suzanne C.

description:
This place is awesome.It's very convenient in location to Union Square.Last time i had broiled seabass that was great!!i love it.
Theyhave one of the best clam chowder i ever had.I'll go back and try other dishes.

Great service and staff,nice atmosphere.
author: Pornteera K.

description: We stumbled on John's Grill just hours after arriving in San Francisco and were out hunting for somewhere to eat. We stopped outside to view the menu, as two ladies walked out and told us to go in, the food is fabulous. So we did. I loved the ambience, the connection to the Maltese Falcon, the decor. Had no idea we'd stumbled upon a landmark. The three of us were seated and a waiter promptly welcomed us and we ordered drinks. I ordered a caesar salad and was discouraged by the waiter as he stated it was very large. So I changed it to a house salad, and ordered the Ravioli Primavera, which was so good I ended up eating the portion I thought I would take back to the hotel. My husband ordered the burger, served open faced, and forgot to mention no tomato (allergy) and so asked to replace just the lettuce, onion, and pickle. The waiter never returned with it, nor did he check in to see if we'd like a second glass of wine. Our companion ordered the salmon, which he said was the best he's ever had. Eventually the waiter did return, passed the buck to someone else who "never brought you the lettuce and pickle?" and apologized. Our companion was a bit riffed, but the waiter soon returned with a complimentary flan surrounded by fresh berries that was absolutely divine, and all was forgiven. The food was delicious. I am very picky about service, as my family owns a fine dining restaurant, and the waiter's forgetfulness did not go unnoticed. He couldn't remember who ordered which wine, nor the entrees we each ordered. He was otherwise pleasant and knew how to smooth a misstep that made us leave happy rather than feeling "meh." On a side note, this being my first trip to San Fran, I was shocked at the number of homeless. One of them made his way loudly into the restaurant, just asking for a cup of coffee. I had my back to him and the door, but the hostess handled the situation well. I could barely hear her voice as she spoke to him, and he was quickly gone. If we ever get back out west, we'll be back.
author: Tara A.

description:
We had a drink and an appetizer at Bourbon Steak but decided to go here for our main meal. So glad we did! Got a great steak dinner for about what we paid for our appetizers. 

The solo jazz guitarist was nice, but he didn't seem to have much of a repetoire. Either that or he forgot what he had played before the set break when he clearly had a "band meeting."
author: Sarah W.

description:
I only ordered the NE Clam chowder and Linguine with clams

Pros:

The waitress was awesome... wish I got her name. We were going to order 2 appetizers and 2 entree' but she suggested 1 entree... glad she did.  No way can we finish another entree.

NE clam chowder was really creamy if you like creamy clam chowder... it's the kind of good o' San Franciscan clam chowder, thick, creamy and lots of clams.  It's not "gourmet" like some high end clam chowder that is really soupy and herby.  This one fills you up.

Cons:

Pasta... well, I think they left the linguine in there for about 10 mins. too long.  The way to make any pasta is supposed to have it 70% done which means it's still look dark yellow and then when you stir them in the sauce it will then cook down to 90%... viola... el dante!  The pasta here is so soggy, it's not funny... the flavor nevertheless, was very rich and flavorful.  Too bad the softened pasta ruined it.

It's pricey, but you are here to witness and experience history.  After all, this is the Maltese Falcon.
author: Mark L.

description:
Maltese Falcon?  Never heard of it.  But I must say this place seems like it's past its prime.  Lots of pictures of famous people on the walls, but I didn't see any since about the mid-1980s when it may have been at its peak.

It seemed like the restaurant wanted to be very formal, but the food hasn't been brought up to date to match the prices and demands of customers.

After the initial apprehension based on the appearance, I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the burger for lunch.
author: Kelly N.

description:
Super amazing place for grill and salad i always order Newyork steak and Ribeye they never make you feel disappoint with Medium Rare super juicy beef feeling fresh 
high quality beef in downtown 

the services are excellent good comnication high skill service  they make you feel high
like dining in five star hotel



Tip should Reservation there are 3 floor i think second floor is the best quite for couple dinner
author: Thamrongpakdi S.

description: A classic San Francisco restaurant and one of the few left that evokes a feeing for the 1930s-1950s.  The Sam Spade thing is pure nostalgia and the place would be just as good without it.  The lamb chops are fabulous.  The service is terrific (third time I've eaten there).  Well worth it.
author: John F.

description:
John's Grill is the pinnacle of a San Francisco experience! I had the pleasure of taking my mom (who was visiting from out of town) for dinner last night and we both loved it!! 

My mom grew up in the heart of AAA quality beef in Alberta, Canada, which means that she tends to be quite critical and picky when it comes to enjoying a hearty steak. She ordered the filet mignon and I chose the halibut, both arrived perfectly prepared with all the fixings. We shared our dishes and were both so impressed with the utmost quality and portion size of our entrees. Additionally, the service was prompt and very pleasant. 

Easily accessible by public transportation or taxi, John's Grill is nestled in the nucleus of San Francisco's shopping, hotel, and theater district. There are 2 levels of dining, which means ample seating (though I would recommend making a reservation as it does fill up) and a quaint bar to grab a tasty cocktail. I noticed on my way to the restroom that there is even an event space on the top floor and signed photos of countless A-list celebrities that have dined there covering the walls of the restaurant.  

After we left the restaurant, my mom kept saying, "I can't believe how tender and tasty that steak was" and expressed that she can't wait to visit again to return to John's Grill. It is no wonder that this marvelous dining establishment has been a staple for over 100 years. 

John's Grill is a San Francisco treat and most definitely worth checking out!!
author: Derwood A.

description:
Busy steakhouse with a reputation as being the place where Hammett would sit and write The Maltese Falcon.

The good:

Despite being really busy I got in and sat at the bar. 

Waiter was great despite being super busy (this is one busy place)

Oyster appetizer was great. Dinner was huge and could barely finish it.

The bad:

meat was very tough, hard to chew. Thought it was just mine but I talked to others who said the same.

The verdict:

High priced San Francisco restaurant with good service but strictly average dinners. For the price one could find better
author: David C.

description: Food was delicious and a very intimate setting. The tables were too close together the entire time we could hear the terrible conversation of our neighbors. However with that being said the two entrees we ordered were very tasty and the service was great!
author: Kara S.

description:
Johnny's is the business man's no frills steak joint.  It is the place to go when you find yourself down on Market street, hungry and just want a solid meal from a joint that greets you like a friend, slaps a piece of meat in front of you and says "Dig in buddy!"  You will walk away with a happy tummy.

Get them to seat you upstairs because there is always a cat playing nice jazz either on piano or guitar.
author: Mikal B.

description:
I'm channeling my girl Sofia Petrillo...

Picture this, San Francisco 2010. It was a cold and rainy day in the city by the bay. I was with two of the most important people in my life, my hubby and good friend. They wanted to get warm and by warm I mean slam down a cocktail or two. I on the other hand do not drink so I guess again I am along for the ride.

We duck into this place that looks like an Irish pub on the outside but turns out to be a steakhouse of sorts on the inside. We were greeted by the hostess and told her we were only here for drinks. Since the bar was packed, she said it would be okay if we sat in the dining area and were seated.

The waitress came by shortly after we were seated and took our drink orders. After those were placed we promptly informed the waitress that we wouldn't be ordering food. A very ugly look befell her face and we were told almost in a tone a mother would use when scolding her child that they only serve food and drinks in this area, not drinks only. We promptly informed her that the hostess said it would be ok and she walked away. Hubby spotted her talking to the hostess then she came back with our drinks not saying anymore about us being in the wrong area.

It was at this point that I began to get very uncomfortable with everyone around us eating lavish meals and us with only our drinks. After the drinks were consumed we paid and were given a slight thank you by the waitress.

And that my friends is how I met your mother...

Oops, wrong show!
author: Steven G.

description: Been here several times for lunch and all I can say is I love the Jack LaLanne salad.  Lots of fresh crab and seafood goodness.  I come here just for that salad.  The atmosphere has a old school feel since they are famous for filming a scene from the Maltese Falcon here, so don't come expecting something new and modern.  But if you want to check out a place with an old school SF feel, swing by for lunch and get the salad and chowder.  Personally one of my favorite lunch combos.  Yum!
author: Elena N.

description: Finally decided to go in and treat myself.  Since I don't eat red meat, I decide for one of the seafood dishes. The red snapper.  I figured it would be a good choice.  I will say that I enjoyed the environment and the staff was attentive and polite. I was rather disappointed by the meal.  From taste, to texture,  didn't leave much to be desired.  Tho I would recommend the place because it's (to me) a San Francisco landmark, I wouldn't hype up the meal.  Then again, a one time trip and one dish tasted doesn't mean the other dishes are bad. Just don't eat the snapper and you might just be alright.
author: Xavier M.

description: I took my mother there for an early dinner on a Tuesday. We were seated immediately. We enjoyed the ambience and the food. We started with the clam chowder, which was one if the best we've ever had. My mother ordered the New Yorker and I had the ribeye. Again, both were delicious and grilled to order. I wouldve rated the restaurant higher had the air conditioning (if they actually have it) was working--it was a very hot September day in the city and no A/C made the experience a bit uncomfortable (they had the front door open, guess it was the best they could do)....I'll definitely be back though, great food!
author: Randy B.

description:
Great service and atmosphere.  Little crowded, as the tabled aren't situated well. But other than that the space is great. 
My server was nice and even gave us a flan on the house!
